briefTitle: Epidural Anesthesia Within an Enhanced Recovery Pathway in Reducing Pain in Patients Undergoing Gynecologic Surgery

armGroups.label: Arm I (epidural placement, ERP)
interventionNames: Other: Intraoperative Complication Management and Prevention

armGroups.label: Arm II (ERP)
interventionNames: Other: Intraoperative Complication Management and Prevention

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Patients undergoing gynecologic surgery via midline vertical laparotomy at University of Wisconsin Hospital and Clinics (UWHC)
* Patients must be English speaking
* Patients must have the ability to understand visual and verbal pain scales
* Patients must be eligible for epidural placement

Exclusion Criteria:

* Known allergy to local anesthetics
* Known history of chronic pain disorders and/or chronic opioid use defined as \> 10 mg of oral (PO) morphine or equivalent used daily for at least 30 days prior to enrollment
* Patient is a prisoner or incarcerated
* Significant liver disease that would inhibit prescription of opioids
* Significant kidney disease that would inhibit administration of gabapentin
* Patient has a history of opioid dependence requiring rehabilitation or the use of opioid antagonists
* Patient is pregnant
* Patients with a planned exploration with biopsies (no organs removed) will be excluded from the study

outcomeMeasures.title: Relative Pain Scores, as Measured by the Pain Numeric Rating Scale (NRS)
outcomeMeasures.description: Relative pain scores between the epidural and non-epidural group will be analyzed by calculating a two-sided 95% confidence interval on the difference in mean scores between the two groups and concluding non-inferiority if this lies entirely below 2 points (mean non-epidural pain score proven, within a 95% confidence limit, to be at most 2 points worse than mean pain score in the epidural group). NRS rates pain on a 1-10 scale, with 1 being no pain, and 10 being the worst pain imaginable.

outcomeMeasures.title: Average Daily Pain Score as Measured by Pain NRS Scores
outcomeMeasures.description: Will be compared using two-sided 95% confidence intervals for their mean differences. Superiority tests at the two-sided .05 level will be conducted by determining whether these confidence intervals overlap.

outcomeMeasures.title: Difference in IL-2 Levels Between Pre-operative and Post-operative Values
outcomeMeasures.description: Will be compared using two-sided 95% confidence intervals for their mean differences. Superiority tests at the two-sided .05 level will be conducted by determining whether these confidence intervals overlap.

outcomeMeasures.title: Epidural Discontinuation Rates Prior to Planned Removal (in Epidural Group Only)
outcomeMeasures.description: Will be tabulated and presented for each group (where applicable).

outcomeMeasures.title: Length of Hospital Stay (Hours)
outcomeMeasures.description: Will be compared using two-sided 95% confidence intervals for their mean differences. Superiority tests at the two-sided .05 level will be conducted by determining whether these confidence intervals overlap.

outcomeMeasures.title: Length of Time Until Return of Bowel Function
outcomeMeasures.description: Will be compared using two-sided 95% confidence intervals for their mean differences. Superiority tests at the two-sided .05 level will be conducted by determining whether these confidence intervals overlap.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Recorded Episodes of Emesis
outcomeMeasures.description: Will be compared using two-sided 95% confidence intervals for their mean differences. Superiority tests at the two-sided .05 level will be conducted by determining whether these confidence intervals overlap.

outcomeMeasures.title: Patient Satisfaction Scores Related to Pain Metrics, as Measured by the Hospital Consumer Assessment of Healthcare Providers and Systems (HCAHPS) Survey
outcomeMeasures.description: Will be compared using two-sided 95% confidence intervals for their mean differences. Superiority tests at the two-sided .05 level will be conducted by determining whether these confidence intervals overlap. Scores range from 1 to 4, with higher scores indicating higher satisfaction.

outcomeMeasures.title: Post-operative Antiemetic Use (Measured in mg of Ondanestron Used in the First 24 Hours After Surgery)
outcomeMeasures.description: Will be compared using two-sided 95% confidence intervals for their mean differences. Superiority tests at the two-sided .05 level will be conducted by determining whether these confidence intervals overlap.

outcomeMeasures.title: Post-operative Complications (UTIs, Thromboembolic Events, Pneumonia, Blood Transfusion, Myocardial Infarction, Falls)
outcomeMeasures.description: \# of events in each group will be reported

outcomeMeasures.title: Readmission Rate
outcomeMeasures.description: Will be compared using two-sided 95% confidence intervals for their mean differences. Superiority tests at the two-sided .05 level will be conducted by determining whether these confidence intervals overlap.

outcomeMeasures.title: Total Opioid Use Measured in Oral Morphine Equivalents (mg)
outcomeMeasures.description: Will be compared using two-sided 95% confidence intervals for their mean differences. Superiority tests at the two-sided .05 level will be conducted by determining whether these confidence intervals overlap.
